methods.clear:
Reset this chunk to empty storage.

Note: Java generics information - <ATTR extends ResettableCharChunk.ATTR_UPPER>

:return: io.deephaven.db.v2.sources.chunk.CharChunk<ATTR>
methods.resetFromArray:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Reset the data and bounds of this chunk to a range or sub-range of the specified array.

*Overload 1*  
  Note: Java generics information - <ATTR extends ResettableCharChunk.ATTR_UPPER>
  
  :param array: (java.lang.Object) - The array
  :param offset: (int) - The offset into array
  :param capacity: (int) - The capacity this should have after reset
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.v2.sources.chunk.CharChunk<ATTR>) this
  
*Overload 2*  
  Note: Java generics information - <ATTR extends ResettableCharChunk.ATTR_UPPER>
  
  :param array: (java.lang.Object) - The array
  :return: (io.deephaven.db.v2.sources.chunk.CharChunk<ATTR>) this
methods.resetFromChunk:

methods.slice:
Make a new Chunk that represents either exactly the same view on the underlying data as this Chunk, or a
 subrange of that view. The view is defined as [0..size) (in the coordinate space of this Chunk).

:param offset: (int) - Offset of the new Chunk, relative to this Chunk. 0   offset   this.size
:param capacity: (int) - Capacity and initial size of the new Chunk. 0   capacity   this.size - offset.
:return: (io.deephaven.db.v2.sources.chunk.ResettableCharChunk) The new Chunk. A new Chunk will always be returned, even if the Chunks represent the same view.
